Articles.Content:
The Hornet VTOL aircraft:

[http://youtu.be/OQA23-0uLzc](https://youtu.be/OQA23-0uLzc)

Actually handles well. I\'m not the best pilot but its a very nice aircraft.

> 
> Whoa, you are alive!

Haha, that I am. Was a rough landing on the recording, I\'ve done much better other times. 

Of course if you are referring to KSP RPG yeah I disappeared, was a little bored of KSP and the drama of the RPG community. Just got back into the forums when I way 0.15 was out!

> 
> Haha, that I am. Was a rough landing on the recording, I\'ve done much better other times.

Well, it didnt explode like mine! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Well, it didnt explode like mine! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Or, in my case, detach the cockpit after a 2m/s rate of decent landing (which is pritty bad thing to happen).

> 
> Or, in my case, detach the cockpit after a 2m/s rate of decent landing (which is pritty bad thing to happen).

Indeed so. This craft is pretty robust. I\'m working on other versions that will incorporate the Damned Robotics plugins so those VTOL engines can be rotated and used.

;D ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) 8) this is! AWESOME :cheers: :w00t:

[mod]Easy on the smileys there champ.[/mod]

I know the threads old, but I\'d like to know what that tail piece is at the end there. Its not stock, and it\'d solve a lot of problemsin putting engines on the end of a body without resorting to the tricoupler.
